name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $identifier
desc: Returns: Identifiers associated with the image - these may include identifiers for the image itself, identifiers for the context of its collection (e.g. series ids) and context ids such as accession numbers or other workflow identifiers.

name: $addidentifier
desc: Identifiers associated with the image - these may include identifiers for the image itself, identifiers for the context of its collection (e.g. series ids) and context ids such as accession numbers or other workflow identifiers.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Identifiers associated with the image - these may include identifiers for the image itself, identifiers for the context of its collection (e.g. series ids) and context ids such as accession numbers or other workflow identifiers.

name: $basedOn
desc: Returns: A procedure that is fulfilled in whole or in part by the creation of this media.

name: $addbasedOn
desc: A procedure that is fulfilled in whole or in part by the creation of this media.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A procedure that is fulfilled in whole or in part by the creation of this media.

name: $::type
desc: Returns: Whether the media is a photo (still image), an audio recording, or a video recording.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Whether the media is a photo (still image), an audio recording, or a video recording.

name: $subtype
desc: Returns: Details of the type of the media - usually, how it was acquired (what type of device). If images sourced from a DICOM system, are wrapped in a Media resource, then this is the modality.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Details of the type of the media - usually, how it was acquired (what type of device). If images sourced from a DICOM system, are wrapped in a Media resource, then this is the modality.

name: $view
desc: Returns: The name of the imaging view e.g. Lateral or Antero-posterior (AP).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The name of the imaging view e.g. Lateral or Antero-posterior (AP).

name: $subject
desc: Returns: Who/What this Media is a record of.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Who/What this Media is a record of.

name: $context
desc: Returns: The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this media.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this media.

name: $operator
desc: Returns: The person who administered the collection of the image.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The person who administered the collection of the image.

name: $reasonCode
desc: Returns: Describes why the event occurred in coded or textual form.

name: $addreasonCode
desc: Describes why the event occurred in coded or textual form.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Describes why the event occurred in coded or textual form.

name: $bodySite
desc: Returns: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the media was collected (i.e. the target site).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the media was collected (i.e. the target site).

name: $device
desc: Returns: The device used to collect the media.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The device used to collect the media.

name: $height
desc: Returns: Height of the image in pixels (photo/video).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Height of the image in pixels (photo/video).

name: $width
desc: Returns: Width of the image in pixels (photo/video).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Width of the image in pixels (photo/video).

name: $frames
desc: Returns: The number of frames in a photo. This is used with a multi-page fax, or an imaging acquisition context that takes multiple slices in a single image, or an animated gif. If there is more than one frame, this SHALL have a value in order to alert interface software that a multi-frame capable rendering widget is required.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The number of frames in a photo. This is used with a multi-page fax, or an imaging acquisition context that takes multiple slices in a single image, or an animated gif. If there is more than one frame, this SHALL have a value in order to alert interface s

name: $duration
desc: Returns: The duration of the recording in seconds - for audio and video.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The duration of the recording in seconds - for audio and video.

name: $content
desc: Returns: The actual content of the media - inline or by direct reference to the media source file.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The actual content of the media - inline or by direct reference to the media source file.

name: $note
desc: Returns: Comments made about the media by the performer, subject or other participants.

name: $addnote
desc: Comments made about the media by the performer, subject or other participants.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Comments made about the media by the performer, subject or other participants.
